intro: Andryala integrifolia var. nigricans, commonly known as blackleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically dark green with a distinctive blackish or purplish underside, giving it its common name. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
